comment.text: This place was really cool. Good bar food and the customer service was even better. I have nothing bad to say about this place based off my visit. Very inviting setting also. I would definitely come back.

I was nervous about the location as it seemed small and I was already tired of paying for parking at the event before dinner. To my surprise, it was big inside and parking was free at the Camden residences. Now on to the food. I did not disappoint. That pull apart garlic cheesy bread was everything. The Brussels hold the bacon was good and the 2 burgers in my party were devoured. Oh yeah we'll be back!

We visited Torched Hop Brewing a few weeks ago to celebrate a friend's 30th birthday. The parking lot is located on the left side of the restaurant in the residential garage for free, which is ALWAYS a plus when you're in Atlanta. 

This spot is kid-friendly and has games to help you occupy your time (and give the kids and adults something to do). The upstairs area has a section with a variety of board games and a tv for playing video games too. My son an I played a Mario racing game.  

Our friend rented the lower section of the restaurant to allow space for about 40 people to gather together. The service went well until towards the last hour - 90 minutes of the event. The staff quit coming down to check in on us for drink/food orders. At that point, we started using the upstairs area and bar to find servers to place orders for food and additional drinks. 

I decided to order lemon pepper wings with French fries. The wings were delicious and well worth the cost for the size and flavor. It had a touch of spice (think mild lemon pepper). The French fries were hand cut and delicious too! 

I think that this would be a good date night spot or meet up place to gather with a group of friends. I noticed that they have a special on Wednesdays that includes the same 6 pcs, fries and a beer, (for a lower price than what I paid on a Saturday) so I think that would be an ideal time for me to come back solo for Happy Hour vibes or even with my family! Overall, I enjoyed myself.

photos.caption: Jumbo Whole Wings and Herbed Fries

comment.text: Amazing everything! The pretzel was inhaled in about 5 minutes and it was huge! The Pineapple Express cocktail, I could drink every single day and the fish sandwich was absolutely delicious!

photos.caption: The cod sandwich and tater tots

comment.text: Phenomenal beer! Awesome vibes! Games! What's not to love!! This place is incredible, can't recommend it enough if you're in Atlanta and you love beer. Great food menu too! The salmon was my favorite.

The bartender Austin was so welcoming!
Great beers on tap. We loved the Pils.
Food was very good. Definitely a step up from the average pub grub menu.
Can't wait until our next visit.

I ordered the fried green tomatoes and vodka gummy bears, along with chicken sandwich and fries. We went for a friends birthday and they were very accomadatng with our group.

I would definitely recommend this place if you are ever in atlanta 

They also have a great mixed drink menu

Large space great for a meetup or happy hour with friends/coworkers. Had a craving for wings so I decided to give their buffalo garlic parmesan a try - they hit the spot! I ordered a side salad, which was good but next time I'll ask for the dressing on the side. Felt optimistic going into dessert but the pie that was on the menu was soooo dry. But all-in-all I enjoyed my time here and perhaps next time I'll try their beer!

photos.caption: Buffalo Garlic Parmesan wings and side salad (beautiful salad but heavy on the dressing)

comment.text: Different location but great atmosphere. Brought the kids and had a good lunch after visiting the aquarium. Beer was excellent and I'm a beer snob. Plenary of games to relax and enjoy some time in the air conditioning.

Bottom Line: Absolutely loved this freaking brewery. One of the best I've been to in America hands down. So many beer and food options and great vibe. Couldn't recommend it more. Their fruited sours are eclectic and delicious. Burger is top notch, watering out of my mouth just writing this! 

Food: awesome options but do prepare for your typical bar foods, but a little elevated. They also have alcoholic gummy bears that they make in house. You gotta order a bunch of these. Never seen anything like this! 
- Cheeseburger: easily one of the best burgers I've had on the East coast. It's simple yet the double Pattie's do it better than most half pounder patties that I've had. Fries were alright but the burger...
- Buffalo wings; just the ordinary but still a favorite. 
- Alcoholic Gummies! 

Drinks: They're primarily an IPA heavy brewery but many great fruited sours, super thick and tastes like an alcoholic smoothie. I couldn't recommend these more! 

Overall: cannot recommend this place more. It's a diamond in an overall great city already.

Decided to head here for my hubby's bday and so glad i did. the owner was quick to respond to my email and very kind. there is street and possibly garage parking. the place is very spacious with several levels. they have board games and bocce ball at the lower levels. we sat on the second floor with service. i will say the service needs work. had to ask for the waiters on several occasions for water and to order (they aren't attentive), that being said, they had 2-3 small parties and 2 large parties including us...do i know they are busy but still they weren't the friendliest. we also had to ask them to clear off the table several times and one of them seemed annoyed a little but we had no space on the table :/ they were busy- i get it but i hate having to ask for things a lot. 
the food is good! wings were delicious, so were the fries and all the appetizers we got. drinks were good too. large beer selection. cocktails and wines are there too. it's really a nice spot overall. so fun for groups of people and large parties. great place to have s big get together. they have large TVs too. we did have fun! great brewery, good food, owner and hostess are super great. the service needs a little work but that's ok. would come here again for sure!
Great food, good beer, eclectic and diverse crowd. Lots of parking. Sat in the front window. The ambiance was great and the service was good too.

Awesome brewery. Great beer, great atmosphere, and very friendly staff. They have a bocce ball court even and that was big with the group.

Was sure to snag a growler to take home as well. Will definitely return next time I'm in Atlanta.

December 20, 2020

My second visit to this uniquely Atlanta mid-town brewery. I was waiting for a pizza that was being prepared next door at Nancy's Chicago style pizza, and decided to have an IPA --- the Wookie Foot, their only hazy, filtered by the way, and tasted great after another 5 hour trip in the car from Jacksonville where I had raced the Ameris Bank Half Marathon, earlier in the morning. I felt a little more refreshed after leaving here, and managed to catch up on social media as I sat at the socially distanced table in the bar area amongst three other patrons.  The service was super friendly.

owner_replies.comment:
Thanks for the review, Frederick! Glad to hear your enjoyed Wookie Foot! It's one of my favorite on tap right now. Hope to see you at the brewpub again soon.

Cheers!
Chris

comment.text: My wife and I had a private party there. They did a phenomenal job! Service and food quality were excellent. Staff was super friendly, accommodating and made sure we had a great time. Excellent beer selection and quality brews. Can't wait to go back!
The T.H.C is really good! It has the right thickness and flavor! The tots are really good! You definitely have to try the Cinnamon Bourbon that is made with Four Roses!
Cool vibe. Great good. Good drinks. I'm not a beer drinker but I still love coming here. Try the Buffalo chicken sandwich - Yum!

Cute Place. Location is one of my favorite streets in the city, Ponce is legendary. The beer flights were so adorable. The food is well thought out. Doc ordered a pimento grilled cheese with fried green tomatoes. Surprised my taste buds. They have games too.

I love the vibe of THB. Real chill brewery with board games, video games, and a bocce court at the self-service area. Upstairs has a full-service seating area with some TVs if that's more your lane. We've come here on our, with a small group of friends, and with a large-ish group. No beat was missed in any visit we've had. Beers are solid. Food is great!
Great place for a falcons game! Killer Philly and great beer. Friendly staff, cool environment.

I loved this place and would definitely come again! There are so many options to choose from and for those who don't like beer, they have cocktails too. They have some really amazing food options too, their loaded fries were bomb! I think pretty much anyone could come here and find something that they like! The place also has a lot of games like bocce ball and shuffleboard and even a Nintendo 64 which I thought was really unique! The best part, they also have a parking garage where you can park for free, which is really hard to come by in an area like this.

Great food, service, and, of course, beer! We each had a flight of beer, some delicious pub grub, and a pint of our favorite beer. We even got some cans to take home. We loved it and we will visit again when we're back in Atlanta.

We walked here so we're sweating and ready for our beers. Supa good loves that beer was served in a wine glass. We got the fried green tomatoes with edible flowers on them think that was the house chow chow Buffalo chicken salad and a Philly cheese steak. Neither the salad or sandwich too exciting but still tasty
Great atmosphere. Great place to meet friends, lots of seating and the board games are a nice touch. My husband loved his sour beer!

such a fun place! they have bocce, shuffleboard, & lots of board games. not the best beer i've had, but decent. they also have a full food menu. i got the sweet chili wings which were really yummy! my friends got the korean bbq wings which unfortunately were not good - way too saucy and weird texture. the fries were good too & come with the wings. we went on a wednesday where they had a deal for wings, fries, & a beer for $13. great service

my GO TO SPOT! this place is the bomb.com for literally all american foods: burgers, wings, pizza and so much more! Its so big so you can def get a table for a good group of people and the prices are so reasonable! If you come here a lot like my bf and I they also sometimes have special items for the weekend! this past weekend we had the pork belly sliders which melted in my mouth! also if youre a wing person i 100% recommend the garlic parmersan buffalo wings! The beers are so great and reasonably priced but for people who dont like beer they also have yummy cocktails and nonalcoholic drinks that look amazing too! 

Also the servers are so great and welcoming!

photos.caption: burger monday deals $10 for burger fries and a beer! best deal ever!!

comment.text: Beer and service was great, ambiance was good, but the food was blah. I had the cheesesteak and fries and my husband had a burger. I'd return for the beer, after I ate elsewhere.

They had no wait for a party of 3 for a Monday night. It's a really chill vibe. The staff is really cool and welcoming. It's a fun place to just hang out and enjoy a drink or a meal.

We discovered that Mondays are Burger Monday, where you can get their burger, fries, and a draft beer for $10. What an incredible deal! The burger was so delicious, topped with cheese and pickles. The fries were perfectly crunchy and seasoned. I got the Cheesin' Hard, an IPA, which was so good!

Highly recommend! I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Burger Monday! (Burger, fries, and draft beer for $10)

comment.text:
covid review:

very strict and clean precautions when arriving here. you must order at bar, and take drink to open table. Prices are very fair for the drinks. Also, the flavors and types of beer are very unique here. I LOVE THE SOURS. Very cool atmosphere, medieval times feeling, but way better. theres also an area that comes off like a sports bar and hang out area. the brewery is HUGE, perfect for groups! or you can chill by the bar at the hightops and have a date.

photos.caption: Very good and innovative beer selection

owner_replies.comment:
Thanks for your review, Desiree. We appreciate your positive feedback! Our team has worked diligently to ensure a safe environment for our customers and staff. We hope to see you at the brewpub again soon!

Cheers,
Chris

comment.text: Torched Hop consistently has amazing food and beer. It is a must visit if you like craft beer- they have a wide diversity of beer styles (sours to stouts) and some of their beers have won GABF medals. Very impressive for a small brew pub. They also have a full bar and handcrafted cocktails (and sometimes alcoholic gummy bears). They have weekly burger and wing specials that you really can't beat.  Their atmosphere is fun, they have a variety of games and an indoor bocce court on the lower level and you can also reserve for private events. There is free parking in the parking garage across the street (Penn Ave).

Great place to grab a beer if you're interested in something hoppy and a small bite to eat. We enjoyed getting a flight to try a few different beers and liked that they had a brunch special including champagne, OJ, and a biscuit. It wasn't too crowed at the time of opening on Saturday. The only reason for 4 stars was the staff was less than friendly and the wings weren't great. It is VERY unique beer so you have to be interested in craft beer,  but they do offer a full bar and speciality cocktails.

Torched Hop Brewing has the best brewpub food I've eaten to date. We were really impressed. Service could be a little faster though.

Torched Hop opened April 2016 in the old Old Spaghetti Factory (https://bit.ly/2ShWMqO) space on Ponce in Midtown. You can park for free in the Camden Midtown Atlanta apartment parking garage. The entrance is on Penn Ave NE. If you can't find parking in the garage, then you'll have to park on the street which is metered.

This is a great neighborhood brewpub that teeters on the 4/5 star line for me. In addition to brewing their own beer on-site, there's a restaurant with good food (definitely above-average food for a bar/pub), games - board games, video games (Nintendo 64 with four controllers and many games to choose from), bocce, shuffleboard, Jenga, and more, TVs, and three levels with different spaces to eat, drink, and hang out. It's similar to Ormsby's in Westside, but I think the food and atmosphere here are better. As far as atmosphere goes, it's relatively spacious and comfortable and the place has a more polished, refined, and stylish look to it when compared to most other bars and pubs in Atlanta. It's a sit-down place.

They have 20 rotating taps, about half of which consist of house drafts. For house beers, they also sell growlers and to-go cans, the latter at the host stand. Outside of that, they sell a wide variety of both local and non-local beer (bottled and canned), spirits, cocktails, shots, and wine. Full bar.

Food-wise, the menu could be described as modern American pub grub. They have a nice assortment of shareable small plates ($4-16 each), from lemon pepper wet wings to Asian-style steamed buns (bao), salads ($6-14 each), burgers and sandwiches ($11-16.50 each), pizza ($14-15 each), entrees ($12-14 each) like fish & chips and bangers & mash, and desserts ($4-6 each) such as "unicorn puke" (cereal treat amalgam) and ice cream sandwiches.

Weekly specials include:
* Burger Monday - burger, fries, and house draft for $10
* Taco Tuesday - $3 tacos (rotating selection)
* Wing Wednesday - 12 wings and house draft for $12

We stopped in for dinner on a Tuesday night and the place wasn't too busy, which was nice. The Taco Tuesday tacos were a mango-habanero marinated chicken taco with pico de gallo and cilantro slaw and a crispy avocado taco with gochujang (spicy Korean sauce) and kimchi slaw. Here's what I tried:

* Sweet Mother of Cherry (6% ABV, 12 oz, $6) - fruited kettle sour
* Roasted bone marrow ($10) - chimichurri, sourdough
* Kale salad (large size, $9) - dried cranberry, candied ginger, pecans, avocado, citrus vinaigrette
* Roasted duck steamed bun ($4) - "dope" cucumbers, eel sauce, bonito mayo, togarashi
* BBQ pork bun ($4) - pickles, slaw, BBQ sauce
* Pretzel-bourbon bread pudding ($6) - hazelnut ice cream, chocolate chips, caramel sauce

I'm not much of a drinker, but I did find the Sweet Mother of Cherry to be a delicious sour. The sourness really hit me at first, but overall, I thought it was an enjoyable and quality beer (coming from someone who doesn't really like beer).

Most of the food was outstanding. The bone marrow and the kale salad were among the best bone marrow and kale salad I've had anywhere. As soon as the bone marrow hit the table, the smell of the garlic from the chimichurri made my mouth water. Their chimichurri was on point and the amount of bone marrow and crunchy sourdough toast was generous. This is a rich app/shareable with excellent flavor. Well done.

The kale salad was terrific with clean and fresh ingredients all around. The game changer was the candied ginger. I thought those were unique and they really enhanced the salad, pretty much taking it to another level. Another highlight was the citrus vinaigrette. It tasted wonderful, zesty, and it wasn't overpowering. A fantastic salad for sure.

I was somewhat disappointed in the buns. The steamed buns themselves were harder and chewier than I would've liked. They weren't as soft nor as fresh as they could've been, but then again, I wonder how many of these things they sell on a Tuesday night. The roasted duck bun tasted kind of funky. Part of it had to do with the bonito mayo which I think is what gave the bun a distinctively fishy taste. I thought it was interesting how they used togarashi, a Japanese red chili pepper spice mix that I normally sprinkle on top of ramen, in the bun. Not sure if it made a noticeable difference.

The BBQ pork bun fared much better. It basically tasted like a pork BBQ sandwich, but in an Asian-style bun. Not bad.

The pretzel-bourbon bread pudding was phenomenal. A definite must-order. Everything about this dessert was great. The highlight for me was the bread pudding. The taste of pretzel was subtle. The consistency of the bread pudding is where the pretzel was more noticeable; not as soft and soggy, holds up better. The flavors - hazelnut ice cream, caramel sauce, bourbon - just melded perfectly together.

The staff was friendly and cool.

photos.caption: Free parking located across Penn Ave NE in the Camden Midtown Atlanta apartment complex parking deck.
Free parking located across Penn Ave NE in the Camden Midtown Atlanta apartment complex parking deck.
Free parking located across Penn Ave NE in the Camden Midtown Atlanta apartment complex parking deck.
Good Vibes is one of Torched Hop's slogans.

comment.text: Good draft beef and tasty hor d'oeuvres. Only complaint was that even though we were ordering dinner kind of late after 8pm, they had run out of several basic items on their menu, so has to just settle for something that I really didn't want. It would have been nice to know before being seated so that we could have made a decision to eat elsewhere.

The food was all very good here but the service was very odd. We walked into the restaurant and nobody at the bar or any host sat us so we headed upstairs to sit down. It was completely empty upstairs and it took awhile for someone to come up to us. Once our waitress notified us she was great it was just an off putting experience at first since we walked in at prime dinner time. The pretzels with cheese dip were awesome!!! The wings were a little dry and a little cold but the sauce was good on them

This review is for a private event that included catering.
To put it simply--Go here! Stephen and all of the staff were FLAWLESS. They made it easy and stress free. The food was top-notch (people are still raving about the miso salmon weeks later!), the atmosphere was relaxed and intimate without being stuffy or feeling confined. Huge variety of beer and wine which made everyone happy. All of that and the price was more than fair.

Great spot in Midtown for solid food and/or drinks. Went here with some relatives who are regulars and it's easy to see why. Had a Buffalo chicken salad here that was quite good and not too spicy. Everything looked good and the beer selection was quite substantial. Friendly service and nice ambiance too. Would definitely come here again.

Love this brewery!! This place has some of the coolest art work and decor plus they have bocce ball. The place is so spacious with three different levels to sit at and all with really cool ambiance. 

They have amazing food in addition to a wide variety of their craft beers. I'm a huge sour/gose fan so I was very excited about their Gobbilygoo and Mowie Wowie. The Mowie Wowie was 100% my favorite - a mix of three different tropical fruits including mango, passion fruit and guava. They also have a list of delicious looking cocktails that I'll have to come back and try. 

At first glance, I thought their menu was kind of bar food mixed with the usual southern dishes like shrimp and grits. However their menu is actually got tons of unique dishes. They have the infamous Impossible burger which is a vegetarian burger that's been modified to have a heme containing protein so apparently it bleeds and tastes like meat. (Thank you Buzzfeed for that fun fact.) They also have some asian dishes including steam buns, bahn mi, fried rice, bone marrow.

- Avocado toast - Not your typical avocado toast! It has diced tofu added in. This was fantastic and a great light brunch!
- Southern breakfast - Wow! Took my cousin here to give him a southern experience and this was absolutely it. It's got fried chicken, eggs, bacon and your choice of potatoes or cheese grits.
- Grilled cheese and tomato soup - Just always so good. You cannot go wrong with this.
- Impossible burger - Not quite sure if I was 100% impressed by this burger. Definitely tastes more like meat than any veggie burger I had. But if I want a vegetarian burger, I want it to taste like black bean or mushroom and not so much like meat.

owner_replies.comment: Thanks so much, Angela! I noticed you're from Greenville, SC. You should definitely check out our friends at Eighth State Brewing Company. They make some awesome beer! Hope to see you at the brewpub the next time you're in Atlanta. Cheers, Chris

comment.text:
Burger Monday's are the besttttt. For $10, you get a double cheeseburger, fries and draft beer. The burger is so juicy and delicious. Two beef patties with ketchup, Duke's mayo (Duh!), house pickles and American and white cheddar cheese. Yummm. The fries are sprinkled with parsley, salt and pepper. Crisp and delicious, they are freaking perfect alongside the burger. The portions are really good, so you'll be sure to get full. 

I've also been there on wing Wednesday. The wings are big and juicy and finger licking good (will I get sued for saying that?). I paired the wings with their Granny Smith salad, which was sooooo freaking delicious. I actually preferred the salad to the wings. It's served with a mustard vinaigrette that adds the perfect blend of acidity and bite to the tart apples. It acts as a really nice palette cleanser to the fatty wings. 

And yo, the service is really great too. Shout out to Jordan at the bar for getting me some pickles for my burger.

owner_replies.comment:
Thanks Cecelia! Burger Monday is our favorite night of the week. Hope to see you at the brewpub again soon!

Cheers,
Chris

comment.text:
Our absolute food/drink highlight of Atlanta. We tried a bunch of places, but this was the one that we were truly excited about coming back to. And the one we found ourselves wishing we had back in Boston. A great open space with such a fun vibe--games of all kinds incl two spaces for groups playing Nintendo and shuffleboard. Oh Brother Where Art Thou was playing on the TVs by the bar and that's just a great choice right there.

Drinks: I loved their imperial stout--my taste runs somewhat sweet high abv stouts and barleywines, and this one felt in the realm of a barleywine. He loved his berry sour. Enjoyed the cocktails too--a really neat variety, with a particularly flavorful Rosemary-Sage Old Fashioned was particularly flavorful. They also have a fantastic selection of beers from other breweries.

Food: And and and, in addition to great drinks, excellent food! We came back a couple days after first getting drinks because food reviews/pics were so good. We were in love with the fried avocado, which has a heavenly delicate coating, and the THC sandwich definitely hits the spot.

A shout out to the friendly and efficient staff, esp our bartender a couple days ago who patiently walked me through their offerings and let me try stuff out since I'm so indecisive... Thanks for making both our visits so great!

owner_replies.comment:
Thanks Stephanie! The Tempura Avocado is one of my favorite menu items. Hope to see you at the brewpub again soon!

Cheers,
Chris

comment.text:
This place is three levels of awesome! They are only open for lunch on Friday's. It was pretty empty do we were able to get a very good seat. Walking in I noticed games that customers can play as well as TVs to watch sports. 
I ordered the infused gummy bears and the server made sure that I knew it wasn't a drink, that they were actually gummy bears. I pretended that I knew that. Lol. I actually thought it was a drink with gummy bears in it.  I wasn't disappointed with the gummy bears! They were amazing. I also ordered a burger and fries. The burger was absolutely delicious! I can't wait to go back!!

Let me tell you something, this place is amazing. Non beer drinkers and beer enthusiasts will fall in love with this place. I came here meeting up with coworkers and have been back several times and they never disappoint. The employees are genuinely amazing (all of them), the mixed drinks are handcrafted using great ingredients and incredibly priced (especially for what you get), and the food is so good. They have staples but I love that they change things up as well. To add in something different, try the boozy gummies. The flavors change and all of them are so good. Literally this place never disappoints! Don't think about it, hesitate, walk... RUN here.

Great low key brunch! I got the Buffalo chicken biscuit, which was super tasty. They have a great deal where you get a bottle of champagne and orange juice with any biscuit for only $9. We went around noon on a Sunday, and it wasn't crowded. Only a few other parties.

Enjoyed my 1st visit to Torched Hop. They have a shared parking deck for restaurant patrons. There is street parking and I think I saw public parking available on the other side of Ponce. The place was extremely clean and we were seated quickly. There are multiple levels, the lower level is order and seat yourself while upstairs was full service restaurant seating. It was not packed at all and we received attentive service. The food was great and I ordered a flight with a wide variety of beer styles, including a great Hazy and Porter. I will definitely be back.

Ep. 26 of Antlantaeats 

Found this spot off a friend's IG post. It looked so delicious 2 days later I was here lol. Driven past this location dozens of times but never knew it existed.

The T.H.C. sandwich is Life!!! I loved the fact the buffalo sauce was drenched and had the perfect crispy taste. While the world was fighting over Popeyes sandwich, this quality gem has been in the corner. If you're a fan of spicy I recommend that sandwich.

Btw their fries were fresh

The IPA I ordered was called "Hops de Leon" from the West Coast 7.2% 

Inside has plenty of space. Well done spot !

Here's my experience:
https://www.instagram.com/p/CEw1XQAh9yq/?igshid=167i1xlgdiccx

owner_replies.comment:
Thanks so much for the review! I'm glad to hear you enjoyed the T.H.C. Chicken Sandwich. It's definitely one of my favorites as well. Hope to see you at the brewpub again soon!

Cheers,
Chris

comment.text:
This place a huge with so many things to do!

They have a bunch of different games, board games, shuffle board, and some other big space taking game that I've never seen before. Plenty of seating and the servers are really nice. There were so many different selections of beer. I had some kind of honey mead, which was so light and refreshing. 

We also ordered wings (which they had a bunch of different sauces/rubs to choose from). They were alright. The flavoring was great, the chicken itself was just fine. 

Great vibes for great beer.
I really loved the pretzel bits with beer cheese, and the beer flights where great. Love the vibe of the place and would totally go back!

An incredible craft brewing gem, in the middle of Atlanta.

I wasn't expecting to find a rad spot to get solid craft beer while visiting Atlanta; Torched Hop proved us wrong. The beer, the food, the service, and the build out of this location are all A+. 

The build out here is huge. There's room to spread out, and they have many games available ranging from a Nintendo 64, to a board game library, to a large Jenga game, to a shuffle board table, and bocce ball court. 

Their menu is a bit intense to get through. It's presented on a clipboard. There's a page for brunch & specials. A page for their beer, guest taps, and beers that will be available soon. A page for bottles. A page for food, and another page for dessert. It's all great, but there are a LOT of choices. 

PROPS: Overall great experience. 
SLOPS: When I visited here, most of the stuff that they were brewing were IPAs and Pales. They were all great beers, but there wasn't as much diversity as some other breweries. (This location makes up for this, by the selection they have available on guest taps).

photos.caption: Where the brewing happens! Award banners hang on the back wall

comment.text:
I've visited Torched Hop a handful of times, usually for Monday Burger Night ($10 for a select beer, burger, and fries).  My husband really likes the games they have available (oversized jenga, for instance), and I really appreciate the food variety and all the space available.

This is a great place for large groups because of the games and free parking.  My company had its holiday party here in the downstairs area.  There were about 13 of us, and we had a great time.

My favorite meal here so far is the burger and fries.  The kale salad is quite sweet (too sweet for me) and the forbidden rice doesn't have enough flavor.  The tater tots and Korean wings are good.

One of the best things about Torched Hop is the free parking.  It's available in the Camden parking garage on Penn Ave at 265 Ponce De Leon Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30308.  The garage is a short walk to the Torched Hop entrance.

If you're looking for an upbeat place to hang with friends, Torched Hop has all you need for a good time!

photos.caption: Playing one of the many games available at Torches Hop

comment.text: We had a great experience at Torched Hop Brewing. There's free parking at the Camden parking deck right behind the restaurant which is a plus. We walked in and saw a sign that said we could go to the bar or seat ourselves upstairs. We went upstairs and was greeted within 3 minutes. Our server was great- I believe his name was Justin. He guided us through the menu and helped us decide on meal. I really wanted to try the Wu Fries but didn't want more fries which came with the T.H.C. Sandwich so I subbed those fries for brussels. The T.H.C. Sandwich was phenomenal! It wasn't just a drizzle of Buffalo but was tossed in Buffalo which was great. My husband's burger was nice and juicy! The Wu-Fries were sooooo good!!! They came out a little late which was fine but they were good we couldn't stop eating them. The only thing I'd recommend is having some tvs upstairs to watch sports. Again, it was a great experience!

GREAT GREAT VIBES and service was KEY! Came here all the way from LA, well not literally BUT did come by to check out the hype... Super cool service and the inside was huge! It was super bowl weekend and still was a great vibe & great service.
Like always ordered so many different things and my friend ended up taking a lot of food to go! LOL when im back in the A, I will definitely be back for sure!

photos.caption: Wu Fries YIKES so bad but so good!

owner_replies.comment:
Thanks for the review, Hiro! I was just out in LA and had a great time at Monkish and Modern Times. Both really cool spots. Hope to see you at the brewpub the next time you're in Atlanta. Cheers!

Chris
